markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub! ‚ù§Ô∏è

To convert string to uppercase in golang, just use ToUpper() method and pass your string, it will convert string into uppercase.

Follow the below tutorial if you are struggling with installing GO in windows.

https://aguidehub.com/blog/how-to-install-golang-in-windows

Today, I will show you how do I convert string to uppercase in golang, as above mentioned I‚Äôm going to use ToUpper() way.

The strings package provide ToUpper() method.

Let‚Äôs start our Golang convert string to uppercase example

Convert whole string into uppercase example

main.go

package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "strings"
)

func main() {

  str1 := "aGuideHub"
  str2 := "Infinitbility"
  str3 := "sortoutcode"

  res1 := strings.ToUpper(str1)
  res2 := strings.ToUpper(str2)
  res3 := strings.ToUpper(str3)

  fmt.Println("Result 1:", res1)
  fmt.Println("Result 2:", res2)
  fmt.Println("Result 3:", res3)
}

In the above example, we have converted string to uppercase and printed in golang console. let‚Äôs check the output.

Output

Result 1: AGUIDEHUB
Result 2: INFINITBILITY
Result 3: SORTOUTCODE

Try it Yourself

I hope it helps you, All the best üëç.
